author: xtremekaxiumcycler12
title: Another example of how great legos are
review:
Picked up this set at my local toys'r'us along with Jimi Stringer and (no laughing) built it at the hair cutting place!

 

  • Pros
  • parts ar mostly new
  • Begins a sweet line
  • Great playability
  • Color! (lime green is awesome)

 

  • Cons
  • Price is a little high
  • Name is just a tad corny...

 

Really awesome set! Spend your money the right way and get it!

author: Kingdonfin
title: Natalie Breez,  A Breezy Start
review:
Well, this is my third Hero Set! I absolutely LOVE it! After a long week at school it was great to come back to  new Hero Set!

Building Experience

Well, this isn't anything "new" really. As most of us would know the building experience from the Av-Matoran or Agori, but it is still different.

Parts

Great parts! New Everything except for the hands and head! Not the best for MOCing as Hero Core and Armor will not fit on anything else! Great helmet though! I also love the ruby Hero Core, it looks great!

Playability

Much like the Toa and Heroes, these are really great to play with! The are easily posed and heaps of fun to play with! It's cool to swap armor with Mark Surge as it looks REALLY good!

Value For Money

The sets are getting expensive. It's almost twice as much as an Av-Matoran was back in '08! But I really like these sets so it is worth it!

Pros

* New Pieces (including Armor, Helmet, Hero Core, Arms, Weapons)
* Ruby Hero Core!
* You can do so much with the weapons!
* Very Fun to play with
* Great look!

Cons

* Helmet is easily broken (Well, it looks that way)
* Weapon a tad too bendy

Overall

I would 100% Recommend this set to all BIONICLE fans and new Hero Factory fans! It is a great buy and has no hollow weapons (Stormer, Stringer, Bulk). a 9/10 from me!

author: C_Fish
title: "...an unsung hero of Hero Factory - Natalie Breez."
review:
Overall:

This set is a great one, but it's really nothing extraordinary, though I feel I'm right in giving it five stars. The lime-green color scheme is a nice touch and a refreshing change after years of blue female Bionicle sets. The helmet lends a slight feminine touch to the set, which is rather nice, seeing as Breez is a girl.
 

Building Experience:

The build is very simple, but it's complicated enough that the instructions may be needed for younger fans. It's not too much different from the Av-Matoran/Agori build, but not quite as boring, mostly due to the legs and feet. (Though it still only takes less than a minute...)
 

Parts:

As said before, the lime-green parts are a nice touch, and the helmet is just feminine enough that you can tell Breez is a girl. The leg armor is great, but lacks in MOC-ability, which is a minor annoyance. Breez's boomerang/grappling hook weapons are made of a slightly rubbery plastic, a substance that's not rubbery enough to be annoying, but flexible to withstand people stepping on it, which is nice. Breez also has a ruby Hero Core, which is cool, but it unfortunately clashes with her orange head.
 

Playability:

Breez has good playability; nothing wonderful, but still fun to play with. The lack of elbow and knee joints is annoying, as it limits posing options as well as playability, but then again, it would be quite difficult for Lego to get joints in such a small figure. A very small drawback is that Breez's weapons are boomerangs, not some sort of shooting weapon, so you can't really blast your family dog (a.k.a. giant city-smashing monster) with them.
 

Value for Money:

This set costs $7.99, which I feel is slightly steep, not bad though. You get four parts that are unique to Breez, which I think is quite a lot, as well as quite a few parts that are only found in 2010 Hero Factory sets.

When you add up the pros and cons, Breez becomes quite a nice little set, one that looks nice on the shelf, one that has good playability, and one that can easily depose of any evil villain under nine feet tall.

For more on Natalie Breez, visit http://herofactory.wikia.com/wiki/Natalie_Breez

author: KodakKid365
title: Not cool
review: Okay, Breeze is a very bad set. The weapons are sorta cool but that's all. The color shceme is boring, her face is ugly, and it's to easy to build. There isn't much to say, she just stinks. I don't reccomend you buy this set unless it's for 5 bucks or less

author: Gresh_Star
title: Great
review:
I bought this set from London, UK for 9 pounds, and it's not bad price. It's really awesome.

Building
Set have 19 pieces. Building is too easy, but not that bad. It's easy to build like Atakus.

Package
You can find Breez in a small canister. It looks preety good.

Playability
Playing with Breez is very fun. In addition you also can buy Thunder like an enemy for her.

Parts
The parts are great. They are great for a HERO Factory MOC, but for a BIONICLE MOC it's not that great. I also like her harpoon-bumerangs.

                                                 Pros and Cons


Pros:
She looks amazing.
Cool weapons.
Preety beautiful colors.
Posable.
Great armor.
Feminic face.

Cons:
None

Overall: 5/5

I recommend this to all Lego Bionicle, Hero Factory and Technic fans.

author: Malurus
title: Ummm...
review: Ok, for starters, I was a bit excited about Hero Factory when it came out. However, when I got Natalie I was depressed, wondering why Bionicle had died off for it's sake. The pieces were too big, and the plastic was cheap and can break very easily (I noticed by the time I was done with her she already snapped at the joints). The playability was very limited as the storyline went WAY to fast and you did'nt have time to callect them all. And eight bucks for a five minute build that is made of cheap plastic?! Sorry, HF fans, but these sets are NOT woth that much.
